oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of Iloprost on the Pharmacokinetics and Renal Disposition of Cyclosporine in Sheep
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hunter, Robert P.
Brown, S. Anthony
Baird, A. N.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cyclosporine
glomerular filtration rate
renovasoconstriction
Iloprost
kidney function
graduate research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cyclosporine (CsA) is a nephrotoxic, cyclic undecapeptide currently used as an immunosuppressive drug. Iloprost (Il), a synthetic prostacyclin, may ameliorate the decrease in glomerular filtration rate (GFR) and renovasoconstriction caused by CsA, because Il dilates renal blood vessels. Six female sheep had both kidneys surgically translocated to a subcutaneous location posterior to the 13th rib. They were maintained for 5 months before the study, and renal function evaluated by serial BUN and serum creatinine and was stable.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 122
